intro: Cyrtandra spartoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandra spartoides thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests and wetlands. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
